item.title: Farnia Village Kickstarter campaign launched – life simulation game by Rune Factory 4 director
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Seeking five million yen in funding.

Shinichi Manabe, the lead programmer of Rune Factory 3 and director of Rune Factory 4, has launched a Kickstarter campaign for Farnia Life, a new life simulation game / action RPG coming to PC via Steam, with hopes of expanding to consoles in the future. It is seeking five million yen (approx. $32,880 USD) in funding.

The game’s staff includes Takanori Tsuji, who wrote the narrative for both Rune Factory 3 and Rune Factory 4; character designers benitama, kannnu, and BOKI simole; and Tomoko Morita of Studio Qareeb, who is composing some of the music tracks.

Manabe will handle most of the game’s development himself—covering everything from coding to modeling, animating, creating effects, the user interface, pixel art, sound effects, and game data—so “it will take some time to complete.” The Kickstarter campaign has an estimated delivery date of September 2028.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

“A game shaped by a fantasy world you’d love to live in…”

With no memory and a small home given to you, a new life in the village begins! Tend fields, fish, cook, forge, fall in love, care for pets, explore the world, and teach a mysterious girl what it means to “enjoy” a meal.

Story

You remember nothing but your own name, and begin a new life in a peaceful village—with a small house and a borrowed field.

Till the soil, go fishing, cook, forge, fall in love, care for your pets, explore the world, and teach a mysterious girl what it means to “enjoy” a meal.

Farming

Grow your land your way—easy to pick up, yet full of depth if you dig in.

Your crops aren’t just for sale; turn them into meals, gifts, or even materials for your forge.

Pal up with monsters to help out around the farm, or make life easier with whimsical tools like floating magic sprinklers.

Adventure

Venture into the world and face a variety of dungeons and formidable foes.

Seasonal dungeons, ever-changing ruins, and the Dark Queen’s castle await.

Team up with villagers or tamed monsters, bring bento boxes, and take on special monsters with unique abilities!

Romance

Enjoy everyday life and seasonal festivals with the villagers, each living life in their own way.

Build friendships through requests and activities, then invite them on adventures, go on dates, or even get married—making your life in Farnia Village truly your own.

item.title: Pastry Panic! coming to Switch 2 in Q1 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Cooperative dessert factory cooking.

Publisher Nicalis and developer Megatent will release Pastry Panic! for Switch 2 in Q1 2026, the companies announced. Physical edition pre-orders are available now via Nicalis Store for $49.99. It includes the full game on the card.

Pastry Panic! first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on March 31, 2022 under the name Turn the Line! It is currently unclear whether the PC version is launching in version 1.0 alongside the Switch 2 release, or whether the PC version’s name is being changed to Pastry Panic!

Here is an overview of the game, via Nicalis:

About

Pastry Panic! is a cooperative dessert factory cooking game. Up to four adorable bunnies team up to mix batter, bake cakes, chop fruit, shave ice, operate machinery… and whatever else the recipes call for!

Hop to it and juggle tasks in a chaotic kitchen, scamper to meet your daily quotas in time and coordinate your team’s efforts to achieve pastry perfection.

Just try to avoid slip-ups, and watch the clock—no bunny likes working overtime!

Key Features

  • Team up in local or online multiplayer for up to four people.
  • Over 30 playable characters to choose from.
  • Play through over 60 challenging stages.
  • Process ingredients with over a dozen different machines.
  • Bake cakes and other tasty delights from lots of different recipes.
  • Help your team navigate obstacles and the bustle of a factory floor.
  • Earn stars based on your team’s performance each day.
  • Coordinate and control two separate bunnies in single-player mode.
  • Select a “theme” and play in Arcade Mode with teammates from all over the world.

item.title: Order Up!! coming to Switch 2 in Q2 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

The kitchen's heating up.

Publisher Nicalis and developer SuperVillain Studios will release Order Up!! for Switch 2 in Q2 2026, the companies announced. Physical edition pre-orders are available now via Nicalis Store for $49.99. It includes the full game on the card.

Order Up!!, or Order Up!, was previously released for Wii, PlayStation 3, 3DS, iOS, and Android.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nicalis:

About

The kitchen’s heating up.

Work your way up from a burger-flippin’ greasy spoon to a four-star chophouse in Order Up!!, the only restaurant simulator that matters!

Process ingredients and cook meals with intuitive controller movements, filling orders as quickly and accurately as possible while juggling multiple tasks.

In addition to your chef duties, players must prepare menus, hire and manage restaurant staff, acquire new equipment and more.

Please the quirky customers of Port Abello island and you just might chop your way to the top!

Key Features

  • Prepare delicious meals from fresh ingredients to please demanding customers.
  • Hire kitchen helpers and delegate tasks to keep up with customer orders.
  • Play mini-games to earn extra money, sharpen your equipment and more.
  • Visit the Farmers Market to purchase new recipes and exotic spices.
  • Prepare “Chef’s Special” recipes to earn the Food Critic’s highest star rating.
  • Get to know your customers, the colorful citizens of Port Abello.
  • Discover the secret of the mysterious Masked Judge.
  • Defeat the reigning Fortified Chef and win the coveted Golden Spatula.

item.title: The Binding of Isaac: Repentance+ coming to Switch 2 in Q1 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Don't go it alone.

Publisher Nicalis and developer Edmund McMillen will release The Binding of Isaac: Repentance+ for Switch 2 in Q1 2026, the companies announced. Physical edition pre-orders are available now via Nicalis Store for $69.99. It includes the full game on the card.

The Binding of Isaac: Repentance, an expansion for The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth, is currently available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam. The Binding of Isaac: Repentance+ is currently in beta for PC via Steam.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nicalis:

About

You don’t have to go it alone.

Experience The Binding of Isaac‘s devious blend of dungeon crawling, twin-stick shooter action and endlessly randomized replayability like never before: with friends online!

Repentance+ includes the entire game—with all downloadable content and hundreds of additions and improvements from updates—plus full-featured online cooperative play for up to four players.

Play online with friends, start or join a match with strangers… and take on Mom and the twisting labyrinths of the Basement, together at last.

Key Features

  • Online play in all game modes, including daily runs, Greed mode, and challenges.
  • Extensive preference filters when hosting or searching for online matches.
  • Emote wheel and voice chat for online communication.
  • New “Item Descriptions” option reveals the full functionality of items you’ve previously collected.
  • New leaderboards for online play.
  • Over 700 different items to collect.
  • More than 300 enemy types and bosses.
  • Multiple difficulty settings, game modes, branching paths and endings to discover.

item.title: DON’T NOD to develop narrative game based on major Netflix IP
item.content:encoded:
Project 'confirms DON'T NOD's ambition to explore new formats including cloud gaming.'

DON’T NOD has signed an agreement with Netflix for the creation of a new narrative game based on a major intellectual property, the company announced. It will be developed by DON’T NOD’s Montreal studio and published by Netflix.

According to DON’T NOD, the project represents a new milestone for the company, “confirming its position as a specialist in storytelling for major [intellectual properties] and its ambition to explore new formats including cloud gaming.”

Further details were not announced.
